I have used an iPod with linux. You need to eject it. Go to the command line and type "eject /dev/path/to/ipod" without the quotes.
how do I export songs to iPod? Should I use gtkpod or just by copying them to /mount/ipod/ ?
The built-in ipod firmware will not read music that you just copy to /media/ipod --  you have to use gtkpod or an equivalent program.
but first I have to do mount /media/ipod'
but first I have to do 'mount /media/ipod' before I can play with gtkpod ?
When you connect your ipod to your computer, your computer should automatically mount it at /mount/ipod.
But yes, your ipod must be mounted before gtkpod can work.
I just did eject it, doesnt it get unoumted then?
When you eject a removable usb hard drive, it is first unmounted and then ejected.
To try gtkpod, unplug your ipod and plug it back in. That will mount it again.
when I unplug/replug the ipod, the Do not disconnect-message appears again and stays there until I eject it
That's fine. That is what's supposed to happen.
When your iPod says "Do not disconnect", that's the time to run gtkpod.
ok. Now I've selected some MP3 dirs with the "+ Dirs"-button. How do I send them to the iPod ?
